publicationStmt.publisher: The Characters that shaped the Silk Road - A Database and Digital Paleography of Tarim

p.note: According to 189 "[w]ritten in large ductus, and clearly preserved, it is the right edge of a large eight line MS."

list.item:
a8 wrättsai because of wräṃtsaimeṃ IOL Toch 179 a 4 to be read wräntsai (MM)


  • Dieser Datensatz wurde automatisch erstellt aus "Peyrot_2007_Martin_20111129_2.xml" am Sat, 2011-12-03, 15:16:59.
  • Image links and standard properties have been added automatically on Tue, 2012-07-31, 03:59:07.


[[Broomhead I]]: 189-190 translates:

a1 The kleśas having been removed vigorously through this power of consideration ...

a2 [it is] nevertheless endowed with kleśas; the monk having also struck ...

a3 The monk's reputation for alms-eating will then come to him.

a4 ... eating alms. The law concerning alms ...

a5 In conduct she turned herself away from crime of her own accord.

a6 the śīla. 80. Of the inhabitants of the northern regions, themselves ...

a7 [He] will appear as cakravartin-king, [as lord?] over the four continents.

a8 He taught the śīla and meditation to them.

b1 ... from the throne ... [he] went to Rājagṛha ...

b2 ... spoke to him. O Omniscient One, today I ...

b3 [he could] not speak at all. He sat silent for the second and third time: [He] spoke ...

b4 day [and] night, and having heard thy voice ...

b5 : The śīla, knowledge [and] meditation ...

b6 Let him always be directed to[wards] nirvāṇa. 85. Citra

b7 Where [there is] emptiness and void he exerts himself. Where [there is] continually ...

b8 seeing [him] turned towards salvation. Being afraid of the apāyas.
According to [[Broomhead I]]: 189 "[w]ritten in large ductus, and clearly preserved, it is the right edge of a large eight line MS."

a1 #M17# /// (ke)ś tättālyñeṣṣai +AP+ tā_u ; maiyyasa maiyyāu|maiyyāwä ++ ; ālu kleśanma|kle|(śanma) a2 #77d %17 #78a %12 /// ; ykāk kleśanmatstse|kleśanmatse : #78b auspa ṣamāne no ; kakautau a3 %3 ; %5 #78c %17 #78d %2 /// (ṣamāne)ntse ; yāṣṣu śawāñcaññe ; yaṃ-ne|yan-ne se klāwi : #79a a4 %17 #79b %12 /// -t ; yāṣṣu śawāñca : #79c yaṣṣuṣṣe pelaikne ; e- a5 %5 ; %5 #79d %17 #80a %2 /// klautkene sa ; ṣañäññesa|ṣaññesa träṅkomeṃ ; klautka a6 %3 #80b %17 #80c %12 ; %1 /// (pa)pāṣṣorñe 80 #80d uttarakuräṣṣeṃts ; mäkceṃts ka a7 %3 ; %5 #81a %17 #81b %2 /// (cakra)vārtti ; walo pākri tākaṃ ; śtwer dvipanmasa|dvipan|(masa) a8 #81c %17 #81d /// wrättsai (aksa)ṣṣ(i) śīl dhyān(a)ṃ b1 #82a %17 #82b /// asāṃmeṃ|(a)sānmeṃ – – masa rāj(ag)r(ine) /// b2 #82d %17 #83a %12 ; %2 /// weña-neś|(we)ñā-neś : #83b ñerwe ñiś poyśeñc· %1 ; – %1 b3 %10 #83c %17 #83d %5 /// (mā) ; kca wentsi ām lyama ; wate tritesa|trītesa : #84a weña t· %1 b4 %14 #84b %17 #84c %1 /// (iṅk)auṃ kästuwer ; tañ ṣpä keklyauṣormeṃ ; weśeññai|weśe|(ññai) b5 %2 #84d %17 /// : #85a papāṣṣorñe|papāṣṣorñ= aiśamñe ; ompalskoññe w· %1 b6 %1 ; %5 #85b %17 #85c %6 ; %3 /// (tā)k(o)y ṣek ; nervāṃś aiwoltse : 80-5 #85d citre b7 %15 #86a %17 #86b /// – ente aikaräññe su spelkkesw ente ṣekaññe b8 #86c %9 /// -kāṣṣeñca ; kartseśc aiwoltse : #86d apāyntasa pärskau ; %11 #87a

[[IDP]]: IOL Toch 11.

Edition: [[Peyrot 2007]]: №11, [[Broomhead I]]: 189-190.

Complete translation: [[Broomhead I]]: 189-190.

Translation: a1 [[Hackstein 1995]]: 214, [[Krause, WTG]]: 122; b2 [[Thomas 1997]]: 83; b3 [[Thomas 1957]]: 193; b6 [[Carling 2000]]: 249.

.

a1 /// ś _t_attālyñeṣṣai tā_u\ maiyyasa maiyyāwä ālu kl[e]- a2 /// ykā_k\ kleśanmatse : auspa ṣamāne no kakautau a3 /// -ntse yāṣṣu śawāñcaññe yan-ne se klāwi : a4 /// -[_t\] yāṣṣu śawāñca : yaṣṣuṣṣe pelaikne e- a5 /// klautkene sa ṣaññesa t_r_aṅkomeṃ klautka a6 /// -pāṣṣorñe 80 uttaraku_r_aṣṣeṃt_s\ _m_akceṃts [k]a a7 /// – vār[t]ti walo pākri tākaṃ śtwer dvipa[n·] a8 /// w_r_attsai – [– ṣ]ṣ· śī_l\ dhyā[n·ṃ] b1 /// – sānmeṃ (–) – masa rāj· ·[r]· /// b2 /// – ñā-neś\ : ñerwe ñiś\ poyśe[ñc· –] b3 /// – kca wentsi ām lyama wate trītesa : weña [t]· b4 /// ·auṃ _k_astuwe_r\• tañä\ _ṣ_p_a keklyauṣormeṃ we[śe] b5 /// : papāṣṣorñ= aiśamñe ompalskoññe w· b6 /// -[k]·yä\ ṣe_k\ nervāṃś\ aiwoltse : 80-5 citre b7 /// – ente aika_r_aññe su spelkkesw ente ṣekaññe b8 /// -[kā]ṣṣeñca kartse_śc\ aiwoltse : apāyntasa _p_arskau

div.p:
a8 wrättsai because of wräṃtsaimeṃ IOL Toch 179 a 4 to be read wräntsai (MM)
